definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Against Inter I want to give continuity to my work and the work of the group.

sentences.english: Wholeness and continuance are the characteristic divisors of landscape investigation in falls group.

sentences.english: Runaway conditions are also predicted by tracing solution curves using continuation method.

sentences.english: This position guarantees continuity as Beijing Playhouse goes from show to show.

sentences.english: It's a satisfying ritual of continuity and caretaking.

sentences.english: Seriality and visual repetition in his work underline this aspect.

sentences.english: The concrete-abstract continuum is explore in later chapters . The concrete-abstract continuum is explained .

sentences.english: All these changes appear in the form of sandhi, and in form of lexical diffusion as well.

sentences.english: With continuity beeper and bright work light.

sentences.english: Main cable conductor doesn't have splice, so has good continuity and decreases possibility of fault point.

sentences.english: Remember to apply a hand mirror design to both sides for continuity.

業務連續性是非常重要的，您不能心存僥倖。

sentences.english: In this paper, we establish some criteria to present the uniformly continuous function.

sentences.english: Presidential arbitration assures regular functioning of the public powers and the continuity of the state.

definition: to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
